attacks.name: Growth Spurt
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Continuous Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Energy Support
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Energy card and attach it to one of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reverse Thrust
attacks.text: Switch Horsea with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Horn Grab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Super Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

ability.name: Energy Barrier
ability.text: If Mr. Mime would be damaged by an attack, reduce that damage by 10 for each basic Energy card attached to Mr. Mime. The maximum amount of damage that can be reduced by Energy Barrier is 20.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Phanpy.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Energy card attached to Ponyta.

attacks.name: Data Sort
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Trainer card in your discard pile, show it to your opponent, and then shuffle it into your deck.

cards.name: Apricorn Forest
text: Once during each player's turn (before attacking), if that player's Bench isn't full, that player flips a coin. If heads, that player shows his or her opponent a basic Energy card from his or her hand. Then, that player searches his or her deck for a Basic Pokémon card of the same type (color) as the revealed Energy card and puts it onto his or her Bench. The player shuffles his or her deck afterward.

cards.name: Darkness Cube 01
text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Energy Switch
text: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Power Plant
text: Once during each of his or her turns, a player may discard a basic Energy card from his or her hand. If that player does, he or she chooses a basic Energy card from his or her discard pile, shows it to his or her opponent, and then puts it into his or her hand.

cards.name: Water Cube 01
text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

cards.name: Weakness Guard
text: As long as this card is attached, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.name: Metal Energy (Special)
text: Damage done to the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to isn't , whenever it damages a Pokémon, reduce that damage by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Metal Energy provides Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Rainbow Energy
text: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Rolling Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Extreme Speed
ability.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Arcanine for each Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Fire Blow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Energy cards attached to Arcanine when you use this attack. If you do, flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each heads.

ability.name: Gluey Slime
ability.text: As long as Ariados is in play, each player must pay an additional Colorless to retreat his or her Active Pokémon. Gluey Slime can't make a player pay more than an additional Colorless to retreat a Pokémon, even if there is more than 1 Ariados in play.

attacks.name: Spider Force
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Flower Supplement
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have any Basic Energy cards in your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of those Energy cards to 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any. You can't use this power if Bellossom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Knife Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Flower Supplement
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Bellossom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Knife Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Happy Healing
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon and flip a coin. If heads, count the number of Energy attached to Blissey and then remove that many damage counters from the chosen Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Smash Bomber
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Super Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Discard any number of Energy cards attached to any of your Pokémon. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards discarded this way. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Called Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Exeggutor. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon)

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Energy card attached to Houndoom.

attacks.name: Dark Impact
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers untill the end of your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: Fluff
ability.text: During your opponent's turn, if Jumpluff would be damaged or affected by an opponent's attack and it already has at least 1 damage counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack (including damage).

attacks.name: Cotton Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lateral Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the total number of Energy attached to your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Burn Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Houndoom.

ability.name: Water Cyclone
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water Energy card from your Active Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Kingdra is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rapids
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any.

ability.name: Magnetic Flow
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Magneton is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon that have Energy cards attached to them. Choose 1 of the Energy cards attached to each of those Pokémon and switch them between the Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Steel Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that are the same type (color) as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon)

ability.name: Fluff
ability.text: During your opponent's turn, if Jumpluff would be damaged or affected by an opponent's attack and it already has at least 1 damage counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack (including damage).

attacks.name: Cotton Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Heavyweight
ability.text: As long as there is a Grass Energy attached to Muk, you must pay an additional ColorlessColorless to retreat it.

attacks.name: Burning Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to Muk. If any of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Burned.

attacks.name: Conduction
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Lanturn. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage for each heads.

ability.name: Suction Cups
ability.text: As long as Octillery is your Active Pokémon, whenever the Defending Pokémon retreats, discard all Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon when it goes to the Bench.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Electric Tackle
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Lanturn. Flip a coin. If tails, Lanturn does 10 damage to itself for each Energy attached to it.

ability.name: Poison Resistance
ability.text: Scizor can't be Poisoned.

attacks.name: Snatch
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with no damage counters on it and snatch the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to Scizor. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

ability.name: Magnetic Flow
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Magneton is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon that have Energy cards attached to them. Choose 1 of the Energy cards attached to each of those Pokémon and switch them between the Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Steel Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that are the same type (color) as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Earth Rage
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nidoking is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Nidoking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Pure Body
ability.text: To attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, you must discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (Attach the Water Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Suicune.)

attacks.name: Hypno Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Strange Tentacles
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), as long as the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon is less than the number of Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, you may choose an Energy card, if any, in your opponent's discard pile and attach it to the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Tentacruel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rupture Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, remove 2 damage counters from Parasect.

attacks.name: Destructive Roar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gigacrush
attacks.text: Each player discards the top 3 cards from his or her deck.

ability.name: Dark Moon
ability.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon and has a Dark Energy attached to it, once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. Choose from it a number of cards up to the number of Dark Energy attached to Umbreon and shuffle them into your opponent's deck. Your opponent then draws the same number of cards from his or her deck. This power can't be used if Umbreon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Quagsire but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Fragrance Trap
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it. This power can't be used if Victreebel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Corrosive Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Poison Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

attacks.name: Addictive Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Supporter cards during his or her next turn.

ability.name: Poison Resistance
ability.text: Scizor can't become Poisoned.

attacks.name: Snatch
attacks.text: Before doing damage, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon with no damage counters on it, you may choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Metal Energy attached to Scizor. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bursting Hand
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Shuffle Attack
attacks.text: Look at a number of cards on top of your opponent's deck equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. Put those cards in any order, and then put them back on top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Earth Rift
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, flip a coin. If tails, this attack can't be used during your next turn.

attacks.name: Iron Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. If 1 is heads and 1 is tails, this attack just does 50 damage.

ability.name: Pure Body
ability.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy from your hand to Suicune, discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (You can’t attach a Water Energy card from your hand if Suicune has no Energy cards attached.)

attacks.name: Hypno Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Strange Tentacles
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), as long as the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon is less than the number of Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, you may choose an Energy card, if any, in your opponent's discard pile and attach it to the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Tentacruel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Dark Moon
ability.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon and has a Dark Energy attached to it, once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. Choose from it a number of cards up to the number of Dark Energy cards attached to Umbreon and shuffle them into your opponent's deck. Your opponent then draws the same number of cards from his or her deck. This power can't be used if Umbreon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: Fragrance Trap
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it. This power can't be used if Victreebel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Corrosive Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Poison Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

attacks.name: Addictive Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Peck Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 damage. If both are heads, this attack does 50 damage. If both are tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Scavenger Hunt
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 cards from your hand into your deck. Then search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Furret is affected by a Special Condition.

ability.name: Enervating Pollen
ability.text: As long as Gloom is in play, Resistance on each player's Pokémon only reduces damage by 10.

attacks.name: Sleep Sap
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Pupitar does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Tyrogue
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Energy Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Teary Eyes
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Cubone by attacks is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Doduo.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

ability.name: Lightweight
ability.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Hoppip for each Grass Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Careless Tackle
attacks.text: Hoppip does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mountain Eater
attacks.text: Your opponent discards the top card from his or her deck. Then you remove a damage counter from Larvitar.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Mug
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Mankey.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Attach 1 Energy card in your discard pile to Mareep.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Onix. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Spy
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck. Put them back in the same order.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Fishing Tail
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, Evolution card, or basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and then put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Rob
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. Choose all Technical Machine and Pokémon Tool cards there and put them into his or her deck. Your opponent shuffles the deck afterward.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card. Show those cards to your opponent and then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Lightning Cube 01
text: Discard all Energy cards attached to this Pokémon. Then, flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards discarded that way. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Pokemon Fan Club
text: Search your deck for up to 2 Baby Pokémon and/or Basic Pokémon cards and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

ability.name: Crystal Type
ability.text: Whenever you attach a Water, Lightning, or Psychic basic Energy card from your hand to Kingdra, Kingdra's type (color) becomes the same as that Energy card type until the end of the turn.

attacks.name: Aquabomb
attacks.text: Kingdra does 10 damage to itself. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance when Kingdra damages itself with this attack.)

attacks.name: Dual Burn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each tails, discard 1 Energy card attached to Kingdra.
